item.title: Ticket #174 (Front page >> "Show most recent x days" has a quirk) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger

item.title: Ticket #174 (Front page >> "Show most recent x days" has a quirk) created
item.dc:creator: ccheaton
item.description:
If you have the reading options in the administration panel set to show the most recent x number of days, say, 2 days, then as long as you post every day, this will be maintained. However, if you don't post for 3 days, what will be displayed, still are the posts from the most recent 2 days when posting was done. This is the desired effect.

If you then post on the 4th day since you last posted, the front page will not display the most recent 2 days worth of posts -- it will only display posts from the fourth day.

The desired effect is for it to show the posts from the 4th day, and then the posts from the last day before that when there were posts made. That way, you always maintain the most recent 2 days worth of posts on the front page, regardless of whether there was a gap in between them.

item.title: Ticket #173 (link rating image links get broken when displaying an archive using ...) created
item.dc:creator: drdave
item.description: if using mod_rewrite (and therefore getting URLs such as "mydomain.com/archives/some_category/"). The src urls to the link rating image get broken. Need to be absolute rather than relative.

item.title: Changeset [1467]: Remove extra slashes from link name and link description.
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Remove extra slashes from link name and link description.

item.title: Ticket #164 (If using GeoURL, can't update posts) updated
item.dc:creator: millette
item.description: Recently, geourl removed it's trackback - which was still there for wordpress to find just yesterday. In my case, I noticed since editing drafts took a whole minute, my php timeout value. I tracked the problem to geourl, but there's actually a flow in the logic around that code. Nothing should get pinged as I'm editing a draft. Geourl shed some light on that problem, we have to take care of the source, not only the symptom.

item.title: Ticket #137 (Comments feed modification time is based on posts, not comments) updated
item.dc:creator: kelson
item.description: The function hugo posted seems to work. I added it and changed the call in wp-blog-header.php on the 2nd, and it's been working fine since then. It even handles the case where I go in and edit a recent comment.

item.title: Ticket #164 (If using GeoURL, can't update posts) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Check the GeoURL site. It says "We are down for renovations. Check back soon!"

So the problem may be on the GeoURL side.

item.title: Ticket #165 (Per-post filters) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I agree. The one thing that is screwing up my blog is how I have used textile 1.0 in some places, HTML in others and now textile 2.0.

Old posts get screwed up every now and then, and I need to find a solution to deal with the maintaince! Per post is one way. Straight up conversion to HTML I think is also another...

item.title: Ticket #164 (If using GeoURL, can't update posts) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I am trying to post now, and I have this error:

Warning: fsockopen(): unable to connect to geourl.org:80 in /usr/share/wordpress/wp-includes/functions.php on line 870

Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /usr/share/wordpress/wp-includes/functions.php:870) in /usr/share/wordpress/wp-admin/post.php on line 340

BLOCKING my post! :(
